result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Joseph Gann

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Defendant's Motion to Revoke Bond
Arraignment on November 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:29 PM Defendant Joshua Joseph Gann appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Joshua Joseph Gann.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions if defendant if he is agreeing to appear by zoom.  Defendant indicates he is. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond remains in effect.
Arraignment scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Subpoena Witness Data Sheet

1:15 PM  Defendant Joshua Joseph Gann appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Shannon Viel appears by video for Joshua J. Gann.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty Viel indicates he's sitting in for Atty Brett Reetz, who will be appointed to represent defendant.    Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim. Court will have JA Parks set prelim. date with Atty Reetz's office.  Bond set.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Joseph Gann
Current: 755 Jefferson Street, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235   (Effective: 02-28-2022)
Prior: 755 Jefferson St; Sturgeon Bay-C, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235
Adjourned initial appearance on September 7, 2022 at 09:20 am.
Reetz Letter to Court re 8-18-22 hearing

9:11 AM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua Joseph Gann in court.   Court reviews events in file, advises SPD not not yet appointed counsel to represent defendant, reschedules matter.  Atty Reetz is present in court, indicates he may take the case as SPD appointment. Court will have clerk contact SPD office to see about getting Atty Reetz appointed.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Per Kylie at SPD, they are still looking for an attorney to represent defendant.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:01 AM  Defendant Joshua Joseph Gann in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, advises SPD has not yet appointed counsel to represent defendant, reschedules matter.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:47 AM    Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua Joseph Gann in court.   Court reviews events in file.  Defendant indicates he's still waiting for SPD to appoint counsel.  Court reschedules matter.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 2/28/22.
$398 by Casey Thompson, $102 by defendant
Adjourned initial appearance on March 31, 2022 at 11:45 am.
To Judge from Victim

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

12:08 PM Defendant Joshua Joseph Gann appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Atty Shannon Viel appeared in court. Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Viel indicates he has a conflict, SPD will be appointing counsel to represent defendant.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Court adjourns matter to allow SPD time to appoint counsel.  State requests cash bond with conditions.  Atty Viel gives bond argument.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 11:45 am.
